SEARCH
Package gw.api.specialhandling

Interface AutomatedHandlerMethods

All Known Implementing Classes:
AutomatedActivityHandler, AutomatedHandler, AutomatedNotificationHandler, ClaimIndicatorAutomatedActivityHandler, ClaimIndicatorAutomatedNotificationHandler, FinancialAutomatedActivityHandler, FinancialAutomatedNotificationHandler
public interface AutomatedHandlerMethods
Methods to be implemented by AutomatedHandlers for obtaining the trigger to test for whether the appropriate special handling action should be executed (i.e., when the trigger fires) and also to actually execute the special handling action
Author:
jdonahue

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    executeSpecialHandling(Claim claim)
    Called by an AutomatedHandler to execute the special handling action (e.g., generation of an email notification or activity) when an associated trigger fires.
    List<String>
    getKeyProperties()
    Returns the names of the properties that should be compared in order to test for whether two handlers are equal as part of avoiding the creation of duplicate handlers.
    AutomatedHandlerTrigger
    getTrigger()
    Retrieves the trigger to test (by calling the AutomatedHandlerTrigger.shouldTrigger(Claim) for whether special handling should action should execute.
    void
    initializeTrigger()
    Initializes a new instance of the correct type of AutomatedHandlerTrigger for this AutomatedHandler and associates it with the handler.

  • Method Details

    • executeSpecialHandling

      void executeSpecialHandling(Claim claim)
      Called by an AutomatedHandler to execute the special handling action (e.g., generation of an email notification or activity) when an associated trigger fires.
      Parameters:
      claim - the Claim for which the special handling is being executed.

    • getKeyProperties

      List<String> getKeyProperties()
      Returns the names of the properties that should be compared in order to test for whether two handlers are equal as part of avoiding the creation of duplicate handlers.
      Returns:
      an array of Strings representing the properties that must have equal values for two handlers of this type to be considered equal.

    • getTrigger

      AutomatedHandlerTrigger getTrigger()
      Retrieves the trigger to test (by calling the AutomatedHandlerTrigger.shouldTrigger(Claim) for whether special handling should action should execute.
      Returns:
      an instance of AutomatedHandlerTrigger

    • initializeTrigger

      void initializeTrigger()
      Initializes a new instance of the correct type of AutomatedHandlerTrigger for this AutomatedHandler and associates it with the handler. If the trigger has already been initialized then this method does no work.
